pr_title: Make memory reservation based on free bytes in insert-from-query

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if this is the behavior we want? Maybe if wantedBytes is less than minAcceptableBytes we should fail?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText:
Maybe if wantedBytes is less than minAcceptableBytes we should fail?

Sounds valid, otherwise it seems that the minAcceptableBytes intention is somehow by-passed.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
@seut pushed a fixup.
Added a IllegalArgument case to the CircuitBreaker and raise the CircuitBreakingException outside. Felt like the more accurate separation of concerns. If the callee of addBytesRangeAndMaybeBreak needs less bytes than what it declares as acceptable, it is doing something wrong and needs to handle that case itself.
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: If free is > 5 MB, but  free * 0.15 isn't, we should probably still allow it?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.message: fixup! fixup! Make memory reservation based on free bytes in insert-from-query

Make memory reservation based on free bytes in insert-from-query

One of our nightly benchmarks failed because it's doing 15 concurrent
insert-from-unnest.

With the logic we had, each insert-from-query operation was allowed to
reserve memory anywhere from 5MB to 15% of the query circuit breaker's
limit.

The problem with that is that the first couple of insert-from-query
operations eagerly use up memory, and then there is nothing left for the
remainder.
